name: Reindeer Bar
description: A well-known bar in the town of Cassandra and the location of THE SECOND MURDER CASE on December 22, 2003—exactly one year after the first murder at Paradil Grand Hotel. The bar has two floors: an open hall on the ground floor and surrounding private booths on the second floor. It is under the protection of local organized crime, and its surveillance system contains blind spots known only to a few insiders.

snapshots.name: Reindeer Bar (Post-Incident)
snapshots.location: A two-story bar in the town of Cassandra
snapshots.description: The crime scene has already been cleaned, and the owners are preparing to reopen the bar. Despite this, the atmosphere remains tense and oppressive. This is THE SECOND MURDER CASE, occurring exactly one year after the first case at Paradil Grand Hotel. The victim was Aberforth Locefern (also known as Jenny Florence), a 21-year-old Black girl who was shot (.357 caliber) and stabbed with a folding knife in the restroom. Several suspects have been brought back here by the police for a second round of questioning.

characters.name: Taran Emilion
characters.location: Behind the bar counter and main hall
characters.notes: Responsible for bartending and part of the service work; operates under Ben Cleo's protection.

characters.name: Lutz Emilion
characters.notes: Handles cleaning, charging customers, and delivering drinks.

characters.name: Ben Cleo
characters.location: Seated at a round table in the hall
characters.notes: A mafia boss and one of the bar's real owners; visibly displeased about being implicated in THE SECOND CASE. He denies involvement in EITHER case.

characters.name: Adolph Carl
characters.notes: Brought in by Bruno for a second interrogation regarding THE SECOND CASE.

characters.name: Marcel Gwynplaine
characters.notes: Witnessed THE SECOND CASE—was THE FIRST PERSON to discover the body of 21-year-old Lucifero in the restroom. When he went to use the restroom, he noticed the women's restroom door was open, saw blood flowing out, pushed the door open and found the victim's body. However, he was afraid of being implicated and pretended not to see anything, trying to leave quietly before Philip discovered the body and shouted. An important figure connected to the case.

characters.name: Simon Laplace
characters.notes: Appears as Simon, but may conceal another personality known as Anatole. Present during THE SECOND CASE.

characters.name: Philip Scaletta
characters.location: Leaning against a wall decorated with reindeer antlers
characters.notes: Witnessed THE SECOND CASE and was THE FIRST PERSON to publicly discover and report the body. He noticed Marcel returning from the restroom looking nervous and suspicious, suspected Marcel might be hiding something or involved in drug dealing. Concerned about what had just happened (the victim seeking help), he went to check the restroom and discovered the body, then shouted—which caught Marcel before he could escape. However, Marcel had actually discovered the body first but was too afraid to report it. A habitual thief who secretly took THE SECOND CASE VICTIM's (21-year-old Lucifero) wallet.

characters.name: Lux Lynch
characters.notes: Bruno's colleague, assisting with crowd control and interrogations for THE SECOND CASE.

events: December 22, 2003: THE SECOND MURDER CASE occurs inside Reindeer Bar—exactly one year after the first case
The victim is Aberforth Locefern (Jenny Florence), a 21-year-old Black girl, killed by gunshot (.357 caliber) and stabbed with a folding knife
This is DISTINCT from the first case: different victim (21 vs 19 years old), different location (bar restroom vs hotel freezer), different method (gunshot/stab vs frozen in ice)

Body discovery sequence: Marcel Gwynplaine was THE FIRST PERSON to discover the body in the restroom (he saw blood flowing out, pushed the door open and found the victim), but he was afraid of being implicated and pretended not to see anything, trying to leave quietly. Philip Scaletta noticed Marcel's nervous expression, went to check the restroom, also discovered the body, and shouted—making Philip the first person to publicly discover and report the body

During questioning: Bruno steps outside to take a phone call. Investigators who notice this (Spot Hidden) and look outside may see a vision (drowning in deep sea, black viscous matter covering the town, material world melting in high temperature, or a huge black monster crawling across the sky—Keeper chooses one). SC 1/1d3

After leaving the bar: Investigators must make a Spot Hidden check when stepping out of the bar. Success: They notice someone seems to be following them, hiding behind a small house nearby. When investigators investigate, they find nothing there. Failure: Nothing is noticed. The Keeper may decide who the watcher is
After the incident, suspects are gathered here for further questioning

snapshots.keeperNotes: Reindeer Bar is the site of THE SECOND MURDER CASE (December 22, 2003), occurring exactly one year after the first case at Paradil Grand Hotel. CRITICALLY DISTINCT: The second victim is Aberforth Locefern (Jenny Florence), 21 years old, killed by gunshot (.357 caliber) and stabbed with a folding knife in the restroom. This is COMPLETELY DIFFERENT from the first case (19-year-old girl, frozen in ice in hotel freezer). Emphasize that these are TWO SEPARATE CASES with TWO DIFFERENT BODIES, exactly one year apart. IMPORTANT: Body discovery sequence—Marcel Gwynplaine was THE FIRST PERSON to discover the body (he saw blood flowing out, pushed the door open and found the victim), but he was afraid of being implicated and pretended not to see anything, trying to leave quietly. Philip Scaletta noticed Marcel's nervous expression, went to check the restroom, also discovered the body, and shouted—making Philip the first person to publicly discover and report the body. Multiple suspects, conflicting testimonies, and the surveillance blind spots allow the Keeper to apply pressure and escalate tension.
permanentChanges: The bar's reputation in town is permanently affected by THE SECOND CASE murder

snapshots.name: Reindeer Bar (Reopened)
snapshots.location: A two-story bar in the town of Cassandra
snapshots.description: The bar has been cleaned and reopened for business. The owners Taran and Lutz have cleaned the restroom where THE SECOND MURDER CASE occurred. The bar is operating normally again, though the memory of the murder still lingers. Regular patrons have returned, and the atmosphere is more relaxed than during the investigation, though some tension remains. Vincent Galenus and Philip Scaletta may visit the bar in the evening for drinks.
